meanings.definition: Able to bend and move easily
meanings.sent1: The cat was the supplest of all, effortlessly jumping from one shelf to another.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her supplest dance moves, captivating the audience with her flexibility.
meanings.sent3: The supplest tree in the forest seemed to wave hello as the wind gently swayed its branches.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was the supplest tool, bending and adapting to new ideas with ease.
meanings.sent5: The supplest fabric draped elegantly over the chair, showcasing its flexibility.

meanings.sent1: The gymnast's routine was the supplest, combining flexibility and grace in every movement.
meanings.sent2: Her supplest gestures conveyed a sense of elegance and poise to everyone around her.
meanings.sent3: The supplest swan glided across the lake, its movements a graceful dance on water.
meanings.sent4: His words flowed with the supplest ease, wrapping the audience in a blanket of grace.
meanings.sent5: The supplest branches of the willow tree swayed gently in the breeze, a picture of gracefulness.

meanings.sent1: The supplest straw in the bunch bent easily under the weight of the sparrow.
meanings.sent2: His supplest fingers effortlessly twisted and turned the wire into intricate shapes.
meanings.sent3: The supplest blade of grass in the field bent low, playing hide and seek with the wind.
meanings.sent4: The supplest branches of the tree reached down to touch the ground, as if bowing in reverence.
meanings.sent5: Her supplest smile curved easily on her lips, brightening up the room with its flexibility.
